- I am a geologist, husband, father, sailor, ...
- a Redmond Barry Distinguished Professor (emeritus) at the University of Melbourne
- a fellow of the Australian Academy of Science 
- my principal research interests are in [earth dynamics](pdfs/2010_JMG_a.pdf), energetics and [landscapes](pdfs/2013_nature12218.pdf)  
- I have travelled and worked in some of the most remote regions of our planet (inc. Antarctica, Tibet, remote Australia) 
- I have the privilege of working in communities that have lived for millennia in some of the most dynamic parts of our planet such as [Timor](https://msandifo.github.io/blog/_site/posts/2016-04-16-travelling-with-timor-leste/), [Xinjiang](https://msandifo.github.io/blog/_site/posts/2020-02-03-a-precarious-geological-bargain/) and [Bhutan](https://theconversation.com/the-will-of-government-is-key-to-energy-access-58332)

- I have regularly contributed to the [popular press](https://theconversation.com/columns/mike-sandiford-228) on [geological](https://msandifo.github.io/blog/_site/posts/2020-02-04-cherrypickingcontrarian/) and [energy issues](https://msandifo.github.io/blog/_site/posts/2020-02-04-renewableenergybythenumbers/)
